intro: Lysiclesia caudata, commonly known as the hairy false heather, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
